business.headline: Will rising Indo-Pak tensions dent foreign investment inflows to India?India's economy, which recently crossed the $4 trillion mark, has minimal direct trade with Pakistan. As a result, cross-border missile strikes carried out by India had limited immediate impact on domestic equities, currencies, or bonds.

Google cuts 200 jobs in latest round of restructuring: ReportGoogle described the changes as "small" adjustments meant to foster "greater collaboration" and improve how quickly teams can serve customers.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as market reacts to India-Pakistan tensionThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading down by 56.88 points to 80,689.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 32.25 points to 24,382.15 as of 9:30 AM.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market to go down amid India-Pakistan tension?At 8:40 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,451. This suggests that the Nifty50 index may open marginally higher or close to Wednesday's closing level of 24,414.4 as investors are expected to be cautious.
Stocks to watch on May 8: Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints, PNBStocks to watch on Thursday, May 8, include several well-known companies such as Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints and PNB.
Government issues Letter of Intent to Musk's satellite internet venture StarlinkPrior to this, the government had issued licences to Eutelsat OneWeb and Jio Satellite Communications.

ULIPs, mutual funds or stocks: What's the best for long-term wealth creation?Mutual funds, ULIPs, and stocks offer different paths to wealth. While ULIPs mix insurance with investment, mutual funds offer flexibility and professional management. Stocks offer high returns but carry more risk and demand expertise.

New NPS rules: How to close your account after renouncing Indian citizenshipAny Indian citizen aged between 18 and 70 years can open an NPS account. Additionally, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs) can also open an NPS account, as long as they meet the necessary requirements set by the PFRDA.

Sensex ends 106 points higher, Nifty above 24,400; Tata Motors jumps 5%The BSE Sensex was up 105.71 points higher to 80,746.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 34.80 points to settle at 24,414.40. Most of the broader market indices also recovered after falling in early trade.

HDFC Bank trims these lending rates from May 7. Will your EMIs go down?This move comes shortly after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate by 25 bps in April, taking the total cut to 50 bps since February 2025.

Operation Sindoor: Should Dalal Street investors worry about what's next?There was no sell-off, no bloodbath, just a bit of volatility. For many retail investors, the calm felt unusual — shouldn't a military flare-up between nuclear neighbours spook the markets? But past data suggests otherwise.

Taking a personal loan for a wedding? Here are 6 key tips to keep in mindWeddings can tempt us to go overboard, but it's best to plan a realistic budget. See where you can cut costs or use your savings first. Borrow just the amount you really need, don't take a bigger loan just because you're eligible for it.

entertainment.headline: Esha Deol says she doesn't behave like a single mother after separationIn a recent interview, Bollywood actress Esha Deol shared insights into her current relationship with her ex-husband Bharat Takhtani. She emphasised her approach to maintaining a cordial connection.

Raid 2 box office Day 7: Ajay's film is Rs 90 crore strong, eyes Rs 100 croreAjay Devgn's recently released film 'Raid 2' is holding steady at the box office. The film is now Rs 90 crore strong and is expected to enter the Rs 100-crore club soon.

Sonu Nigam's song from Kannada film removed two days after his apologySinger Sonu Nigam's song from the Kannada film, 'Kuladalli Keelyavudo', has been removed after his controversial remarks at his Bengaluru concert. Though he apologised for his remarks, action has been taken against him.

Anushka-Virat step out for a dinner date, fans notice something unusualIn their first public appearance since the Avneet Kaur controversy, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen on a dinner date in Bengaluru. However, fans noticed something unusual, sparking a wave of online discussion.

Aakanksha Singh recalls being called 'gaddaar' after Khakee Bengal ChapterActor Aakanksha Singh, recently seen in 'Khakee: The Bengal Chapter', revealed being called a 'gaddaar' after the show's release. In an exclusive interview, she also opened up about working with the stalwarts of the Bengali film industry, Jeet, Prosenjit and Saswata Chatterjee.

Samantha's latest photo dump features selfie with Raj Nidimoru, says new beginningsActor Samantha shared a new photo dump and talked about new beginnings. It featured a selfie with director Raj Nidimoru and more pictures with 'Subham' team.

Deepika Padukone reveals how she and Ranveer Singh chose daughter Dua's nameDeepika Padukone, in a latest interview, opened up about how she and her husband Ranveer Singh zeroed in on daughter Dua's name. Dua was born in September 2024.

3 Doors Down's Brad Arnold diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancerBrad Arnold of 3 Doors Down has been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer, prompting tour cancellation. Despite the seriousness, he remains calm and hopeful, asking fans for prayers and support.

Hips Don't Lie turns 20: Shakira and Wyclef Jean perform iconic hit liveShakira and Wyclef Jean celebrated the 20th anniversary of Hips Don't Lie with a live reunion on The Tonight Show. She kicks off her largest stadium tour in May 2025.

Ladies of London Returns: Bravo unveils 2025 reality show lineupBravo is expanding its reality TV lineup with four new shows in 2025, including Real Housewives of Rhode Island and a Ladies of London reboot, while also bringing back several fan favorites.

Jury in Diddy's sex trafficking trial to be finalized Friday, trial starts MondayJury selection in Sean "Diddy" Combs' federal trial wraps on Friday, with opening statements set for Monday. He faces life in prison over serious sex trafficking and racketeering charges.

Deepika Padukone on her pregnancy: I went through a lotDeepika Padukone, who recently welcomed her baby girl Dua, opened up about her tough pregnancy journey and the emotional meaning behind her daughter's name. The actor is currently enjoying motherhood and has not announced her next film yet.

Neil Nitin Mukesh wants to work with Deepika Padukone again: She inspires meActor Neil Nitin Mukesh reminisces about his experience working with Deepika Padukone in 'Lafangey Parindey', highlighting their bond and his admiration for her dedication and talent. Despite busy lives, Neil cherishes their friendship and wishes to reunite with her on screen.

Naga Chaitanya begins shoot for his first pan-India film NC 24Naga Chaitanya, riding high on the success of his recent release 'Thandel', released the first-look poster of his next film, a sci-fi action adventure, tentatively titled 'NC24'.

Dulquer Salmaan shares adorable moment with daughter on superbike. See picDulquer Salmaan was seen teaching his daughter Maryam to handle a bike on her 8th birthday, winning hearts online. The cute father-daughter moment came during a week full of celebrations in the Mammootty family.

Karan Johar reacts to 'career destroyer' tag, says 'I just do my job'Filmmaker Karan Johar responded to criticism claiming he has negatively impacted careers in Bollywood, stating that his support for outsiders is often overlooked, while the focus remains solely on the star kids he has launched.

Hina Khan begins her 'highly exciting' trip to South Korea, shares photosHina Khan has embarked on her first trip to South Korea, calling it a 'much-needed' and 'highly exciting' journey. While battling cancer, she is enjoying traveling again and sharing happy moments with her fans.

21 years of Arya, a film that changed Allu Arjun's life foreverAllu Arjun celebrates 21 years of Arya today - the film that marked the beginning of his career-changing journey. Reflecting on its impact, he expressed gratitude for the love and memories it created.

Sonu Sood to be honoured with Humanitarian Award for Covid-19 relief workActor Sonu Sood will receive the Humanitarian Award at the Miss World 2025 grand finale. The award will recognise Sood for his contributions during the Covid-19 pandemic.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor's 100% precision: Satellite pics show direct hit on Jaish terror campCaptured by Maxar Technologies, the satellite visuals show before-and-after comparisons of sites in Bahawalpur and Muridke, both known strongholds of banned terror outfits.

Pak continues relentless shelling along LoC after Op Sindoor, jawan diesThe latest round of shelling came hours after India launched Operation Sindoor, a high-precision military offensive that struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

5 dead after private chopper crashes near Bhagirathi River in UttarakhandA private chopper, heading towards Gangotri with 5 to 6 passengers onboard, crashed in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district around 9 AM.

Blasts heard in Lahore, drone shot down day after India's Op Sindoor: ReportThe series of explosions in Lahore comes a day after India struck terror camps in Pakistan, in an operation named 'Sindoor', in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

Kashmir after Baisaran: Ten takeawaysPost the horrendous terror attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran meadows and the Indian armed forces retaliation, it is apparent that Kashmir is churning yet again, the churn reflecting many dimensions, old and new.

Government to brief Opposition on Operation Sindoor in all-party meet todayThe government will brief opposition leaders on Operation Sindoor, which struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir (POK) on earlier Wednesday morning.

Rohit Sharma: A topsy-turvy Test career which found its groove in 2nd inningsRohit Sharma announced his retirement from Test cricket after a 12-year-long career, which could well have begun three years earlier if not for a freak injury. After failing to live up to the expectations, the Hitman came back to rule the format in his rebirth as a Test opener and guided India to several memorable victories.

Will avenge: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif threatens retaliation to Operation SindoorOperation Sindoor marked India's biggest cross-border attack since the 2019 Balakot airstrikes, targeting nine terror hubs in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir (POK).

Diljit Dosanjh, Emma Chamberlain and Cartier controversy about Patiala necklaceThe Internet cannot stop talking about why Diljit Dosanjh couldn't wear the Patiala Necklace at Met Gala despite his stylist's efforts to source it from Cartier.

Rohit Sharma: A topsy-turvy Test career which found its groove in 2nd inningsRohit Sharma announced his retirement from Test cricket after a 12-year-long career, which could well have begun three years earlier if not for a freak injury. After failing to live up to the expectations, the Hitman came back to rule the format in his rebirth as a Test opener and guided India to several memorable victories.

Pakistan's propaganda machine in overdrive after Operation SindoorPIB Fact Check has highlighted several instances of misinformation circulated by Pakistani social media handles in the wake of India's Operation Sindoor.

Trump teases major trade deal with 'big, highly respected country' tomorrowUS President Donald Trump teased the announcement of a major trade deal with a "big, and highly respected, country" on Thursday.

Jasprit Bumrah should captain in England Tests, Shubman Gill his deputy: MSK PrasadIndia tour of England: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, former chairman of selectors MSK Prasad dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's fitness and urged the selection committee to appoint him captain for the England Tests. India are on the lookout for Rohit Sharma's successor after the 38-year-old retired from Test cricket on Wednesday, May 7.
A 'Pahalgam' chill after India-China thaw?China backing Pakistan's proposal for an independent probe into the terror attack threatens to undo the recent breakthrough in New Delhi-Beijing ties

Faith over fear: Gurdwara in J&K's Poonch reopens day after Pak shellingPrayers have resumed inside the gurdwara, even as signs of yesterday's destruction, the shell marks and the spots where lives were lost, remain fresh.

Shashi Tharoor's 'shabhashi' to those who came up with Op Sindoor codename, imageCongress MP Shashi Tharoor praised the government and armed forces following the high-intensity cross-border strikes codenamed Operation Sindoor. The Congress MP praised both the operation, its name and image.

Samantha's latest photo dump features selfie with Raj Nidimoru, says new beginningsActor Samantha shared a new photo dump and talked about new beginnings. It featured a selfie with director Raj Nidimoru and more pictures with 'Subham' team.

Gujarat Board Class 10 Result 2025 declared. Steps to download scorecardsThe Gujarat Board has officially announced the GSEB Class 10 (SSC) Result 2025 today, May 8, at 8 am. Students can now access their scorecards online by entering their six-digit seat number at gseb.org.

Air Force in sky, Army on ground - India's 2-pronged attack on terror camps: SourcesWhile the Indian Air Force (IAF) carried out air-to-surface missile attacks, the Indian Army simultaneously launched surface-to-surface missiles in Pakistan and POK, sources said.

Starlink gets approval to roll out satellite internet services in India: ReportElon Musk's Starlink has reportedly received the approvals from the Department of Telecom to rollout and operate its satellite internet services in India.

Sonu Nigam's song from Kannada film removed two days after his apologySinger Sonu Nigam's song from the Kannada film, 'Kuladalli Keelyavudo', has been removed after his controversial remarks at his Bengaluru concert. Though he apologised for his remarks, action has been taken against him.

I want to see it stop: Trump offers to play mediator as India-Pak tensions riseAs tensions soar between India and Pakistan, US President Donald Trump has offered to mediate, saying he wants both nations to "stop now" after India launched major strikes on terror camps in response to a deadly attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

No pope elected on first day, black smoke emerges from Sistine ChapelBlack smoke rose from the Sistine Chapel chimney Wednesday night, signaling no pope was elected in the first conclave vote. Cardinals will resume voting Thursday as thousands wait in St. Peter's Square for white smoke to announce a new pontiff.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

sports.headline: Chess champion Yuzi Chahal has always proved naysayers wrong: PBKS coach JoshiIPL 2025: Speaking to the press on the eve of their game against Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala, Punjab Kings' spin-bowling coach Sunil Joshi heaped praise on Yuzvendra Chahal's consistency in the IPL and his ability to bounce back from setbacks.

Replacement spree continues as RR sign 19-year-old South Africa starRajasthan Royals have signed Lhuan-dre Pretorius to replace the injured Nitish Rana. This move comes amid a broader trend of mid-season player replacements in IPL 2025.

Rohit Sharma deserved a farewell Test: Manoj TiwariFormer India batter and Bengal captain Manoj Tiwari feels Rohit Sharma deserved a proper farewell on the field rather than an announcement via social media.

IPL 2025: Win over KKR brings immense satisfaction, says CSK's batting coachChennai Super Kings batting coach Michael Hussey said the hard-fought win over KKR would bring immense satisfaction to the players, support staff, and fans alike.

Ajinkya Rahane believes KKR can still qualify for playoffs despite CSK lossKolkata Knight Riders captain Ajinkya Rahane remains hopeful of playoff qualification following a heartbreaking loss to Chennai Super Kings at Eden Gardens on Wednesday. He believes KKR can still make it if they win their remaining two league matches, both of which are away fixtures.

DC head coach praises 'Operation Sindoor' as India strikes Pakistan terror campsDelhi Capitals (DC) head coach Hemang Badani expressed his heartfelt support for the Indian Army during a pre-match press conference ahead of DC's IPL 2025 encounter against Punjab Kings (PBKS) on Wednesday.

Rohit Sharma's Test retirement surprises Ajinkya Rahane: I will call himRohit Sharma's sudden Test retirement came as a shock to Ajinkya Rahane, his longtime teammate and friend. Speaking moments after KKR's loss to CSK on Wednesday, a visibly surprised Rahane learned of the news during the post-match press conference.

Jasprit Bumrah should captain in England Tests, Shubman Gill his deputy: MSK PrasadIndia tour of England: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, former chairman of selectors MSK Prasad dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's fitness and urged the selection committee to appoint him captain for the England Tests. India are on the lookout for Rohit Sharma's successor after the 38-year-old retired from Test cricket on Wednesday, May 7.

Who will not miss Rohit Sharma? Virender Sehwag on star batter's Test retirement Virender Sehwag heaped praise on Rohit Sharma and said that everyone will miss having the star batter in the squad after he announced his Test retirement on Wednesday, May 7. Sehwag feels that Rohit will have no regrets about making the call.

IPL 2025: Can KKR make it to the playoffs despite heartbreaking CSK loss?KKR's title defence took a massive hit after their heartbreaking loss to CSK at the Eden Gardens on Wednesday, May 7. However, the three-time champions can still make it to the playoffs, but will need help from others.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
